title: get you a chiropractor that can do this

replies.body: and a Dermatologist, that skin is so healthy now if you ignore the fact he is practically dead
And new Fashion designer...

Idk about that, whoever his fashion designer is dug up a tombstone and plopped it on his back...

Maybe it's his chiropractor's technique :o)

I mean If this can be fashion a tombtone doesn't bother me...
http://www.slappedham.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/042450c04d0661bb09091a7b8e1b3987.jpg

That's nothing. Google "stupid fashion", and prepare to see some of the dumbest things you'll ever see in your life.
https://fashionisstupid.files.wordpress.com/2010/02/2-280.jpg?noredirect
http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/dd1662d5e3a6595615bc9cfb6366b880.jpg

> [{quoted}](name=Zarvanis,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=ARmo2uA8,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-24T18:35:09.441+0000)
>
> That's nothing. Google "stupid fashion", and prepare to see some of the dumbest things you'll ever see in your life.
> https://fashionisstupid.files.wordpress.com/2010/02/2-280.jpg?noredirect

{{champion:120}} waifu spotted

I actually couldn't remember any example out of head (there's one topic in one forum I visit specifically for these... ehm... interesants where I see such things) so I Googled "crazy fashion". Close enough.

BTW I Googled it and am surprised that from all these things you've chosen the most normal looking one :D

> BTW I Googled it and am surprised that from all these things you've chosen the most normal looking one :D

Yeah, didn't want to spoil the surprise, but wanted to whet a viewer's interest in seeing just how absurd it gets.
I think I've seen some of these fashion trends in Dark Souls...
I feel like if you put any kind of clothing on a hot girl it'll look good.

> [{quoted}](name=Zydron,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=ARmo2uA8,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-24T15:02:20.100+0000)
>
> and a Dermatologist, that skin is so healthy now if you ignore the fact he is practically dead

Acorrding to his new lore he isn't dead(i think) just corrupted by the shadow isles.
That's why I said "practically"

I think the new art is too monochrome.  He just has many different shades of the same color, and that's the same problem with Kindred. THey need more color, not just different shades of the same color.

> [{quoted}](name=AssauIto,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=ARmo2uA8,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-08-24T16:48:20.307+0000)
>
> I think the new art is too monochrome.  He just has many different shades of the same color, and that's the same problem with Kindred. THey need more color, not just different shades of the same color.

I think you're missing the aesthetic of the Shadow Isles. It's a dark, dead place with very little life and very little color. All of its inhabitants are either specters or wraiths, and Yorick follows their design patterns.

I get what he means, he could be more colorful with darker shades to keep pattern, however...
After your post I imagined that opposite of Shadow Isles might be Rainbow Pride and... The pictures in my head... lol.

Wait, what?

Kindred uses the same colors too often?

Are you serious?
her base skin. her two retail skins do an excellent job of making her making her look exciting.

...

She's supposed to use a limited color pallete, her whole thing is duality of black-white, to match the mythical Grim Reaper.

true, but she's mostly just a wash of blues and wolf a wash of dark purple smoke with a white mask.

it has a theme, but it's bland. that's the argument. the issue isn't the theme, it's the execution.
"It only took 6 months of hardcore Yoga..."
"Chiropractors hate him!"
Scoliosis patient here! Riot, if you could perhaps fix me like you did yorick would be nice k thanks!
Or don't, because chiropractic is pseudo science bs. It's like overpaying a masseuse because they also provide placebos. Oh and it could permanently injure you...

"Oh and it could permanently injure you..." You know what can permanently injure you? Lifting something wrong, rolling out of bed, biting your tongue, eating gluten. But I'm sure you do all of these from time to time, and you're still fine. That being said, for someone to call chiropractics bs is laughable at best. Even if you don't understand how your body actually works (which you obviously don't) even the most basic explanations are more than sufficient. 
"Your body _naturally_ gets out of alignment when you do something too strenuous or you stretch your muscles incorrectly to their so called breaking point. As a result your muscles will pull incorrectly and cause your bones, namely the spine, to be wretched out of alignment. If you go to a professional and well taught chiropractor, you can reverse even some of the most damaging injuries over time." 
If this is somehow beyond your comprehension, I think you may need a developmental specialist. But instead you went to a chiropractor.... which is probably why you're upset about the outcome......
I wanted to downvote because it was pretty rude but.. that last bit killed me, it was such a good burn that I had to upvote. Damn you!
To be fair, when someone goes on some little rant about how he strongly disagrees with reality, it typically justifies an abrasive response.
I'd just downvote and move on, honestly, since chances are they'll just reply again and get even more people sucked into it. But that could just be me.

>You know what can permanently injure you?

I do. But those things have real benefits beyond the placebo effect and a massage. The same cannot be said for chiropractic.

>Your body naturally gets out of alignment when you do something too strenuous or you stretch your muscles incorrectly to their so called breaking point.

No, it doesn't. There is no general body 'alignment.' There are real body alignments such as your spinal cord. But the alignments chiropractic stuff refer to outside of this are almost all mystical bs.

>But instead you went to a chiropractor.... which is probably why you're upset about the outcome......

I didn't go to one. I know better. If I need medical help I'll go see a real doctor.
A real doctor? What exactly makes a doctor "real."
http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/creepypasta/images/a/a3/Oh-You-Make-Me-Cry-Laughing-Meme-Rage-Face-.png/revision/latest?cb=20140111193717
Still waiting on an answer, but obviously you don't have one.
I'm not your google. Validate your own beliefs, theories, and existence. You won't be swayed by anything I say here, you've drunk the koolaid. You've gotta do it on your own.
You seem to be very passionate about something you know little of.
Oh I know quite a bit about it. More than many people who consider themselves practitioners of it in fact.
So you know nothing of it, not even its practice. You went to a fake one once and got screwed up is my guess.

I've never been to one as a patient. But I have researched the issue quite a bit. But the fanatical defender attitude shown in this thread alone is just one more bit of evidence in a long list of signs it's more cult than science.
So you have no experience with it.

Yeah. Unless you count my tons of research, talking to people about it, seeing it, ect. If your argument is literally "well you've never tried first hand it so you can't know it's bullshit" I've got the best tasting soda in the world to sell you, super legit, and pretty inexpensive considering it's the best in the world, I promise. ;)

"Tons of research."

You did a little searching on the internet and you're pretending you know anything about a medical practice. I bet you think vaccines are fake too.

Vaccines are very real and effective, based on actual science, unlike chiropractic... which was invented relatively recently by a guy who thought he could cure people by moving hand held magnets over parts of their body despite any actual evidence of his several crazy theories.

You.... You don't even know what we're talking about. 

Chiropractics has nothing to do with magnets. It's glorified massage, if you really want to insult the practice. 

But you've just proven you don't even know what we're talking about. You're confused on the practice we're even discussing.
I know it doesn't use magnets and that it's glorified massage now. But it didn't start that way. Most of its believers don't know all that though.
You can't form a logical argument based on what the practice used to be.

Yes you can... If something started based on bullshit it has to introduce a lot of new non bullshit to become something better. It never stopped being based on bullshit, it just changed the bullshit. It still claims to do things it does not do and work in ways it does not work.

I'm not your google, I'm not your youtube, I'm not your anything. If you're actually willing to listen to reason and science and be convinced by evidence, which I highly doubt, try researching it yourself because if I do it you'll just dismiss it all anyways.

Care to state where you're getting your information and what liars you're pretending are chiropractors? 

I know a few personally, and they've never made wild claims that it'll make me lose weight or increase my hair's health. At this point it's pretty clear you're just trolling for kicks.
Maiden of the Mist beauty salon: making your afterlife beautifull since 1989 (btw I know yorick isn't dead yet but w/e )
As a Chiropractic student, I feel this rework in a much deeper way after seeing this.
